Posted By: RafiqTheMiststalker (5/11/2010 4:08:11 AM)

posts.post_content:
In case you're going to build a deck around her, there are two related DailyMTG articles, look up "Jhoira Goes Up".  
  
Her main uses are the follows:  
1) Bring out expensive spells  
2) Use suspend cards that profit from the effect  
either a) Those with high suspend countdown ([Nihilith](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Nihilith), [Deep-Sea Kraken](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Deep-Sea Kraken), [Greater Gargadon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Greater Gargadon) or [Heroes Remembered](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Heroes Remembered))  
and/or b) Those who give a profitable effect while suspended (those are most above mentioned cards, or those with X-cost, being [Aeon Chronicler](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Aeon Chronicler) [Roiling Horror](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Roiling Horror), [Benalish Commander](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Benalish Commander), [Fungal Behemoth](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fungal Behemoth) and [Detritivore](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Detritivore).  
3) Prepare some delayed, but tough storm effects  
  
She also combines nicely with cards that let the suspended cards being cast quicker by removing time counters, such as [her timebug](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=118879), [Rift Elemental](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rift Elemental)... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
In case you're going to build a deck around her, there are two related DailyMTG articles, look up "Jhoira Goes Up".

Her main uses are the follows:
1) Bring out expensive spells
2) Use suspend cards that profit from the effect
either a) Those with high suspend countdown (Nihilith, Deep-Sea Kraken, Greater Gargadon or Heroes Remembered)
and/or b) Those who give a profitable effect while suspended (those are most above mentioned cards, or those with X-cost, being Aeon Chronicler Roiling Horror, Benalish Commander, Fungal Behemoth and Detritivore.
3) Prepare some delayed, but tough storm effects

She also combines nicely with cards that let the suspended cards being cast quicker by removing time counters, such as her timebug, Rift Elemental... (see all)

Posted By: Mode (8/29/2009 11:59:32 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
@Ipotato: I'm not entirely sure about this, but I'm going to say no. The way suspend works is that it allows you to play the spell without playing its mana cost, it doesn't just put the spell on the stack. Since the Epic ability prevents you from casting new spells, you can't cast the suspended spell- even though it's free and you don't have a choice.   
  
For the same reason, you couldn't play 2 epic spells at the same time using this: one of them would have to resolve first, and the epic ability on that first spell would prevent the second one from being played.
posts.html:
@Ipotato: I'm not entirely sure about this, but I'm going to say no. The way suspend works is that it allows you to play the spell without playing its mana cost, it doesn't just put the spell on the stack. Since the Epic ability prevents you from casting new spells, you can't cast the suspended spell- even though it's free and you don't have a choice.

For the same reason, you couldn't play 2 epic spells at the same time using this: one of them would have to resolve first, and the epic ability on that first spell would prevent the second one from being played.

posts.post_content: Even though Epic doesn't work that way, she's in the most common copy colors. [Reverberation](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Reverberation), [increasing vengence](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=increasing vengence), [twincast](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=twincast), ect. She gives you easily enough time to copy it 3-4 times by the time it comes out, which you can use with epic cards. Searching opponents library 4 times for permanents each turn sounds like fun, paradox haze also seems to be in her colors, make that 8 times.
